poem:
Outside the Walls

From distant shores, a woman flees,  
her shadow cast by fleeing fear,  
where silence and whispers stifle.  
Beneath foreign skies, roots unfurl,  
yet paper fences rise, stern,  
stifling the breath of freedom.  
In the gentle grip of dreams,  
so entangled, hope shimmers,  
but the walls remain, cold, unyielding.
